result.execSummary:
The defendant Brecca A. Benton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Brecca A. Benton in court, in custody.  9:30 AM  Court calls case and recites appearances - DE sentenced in Dec. 2015 by Judge John Anderson - this is a request for revocation of huber and good time.  Court - Judge Anderson has no objection to Judge Yackel doing this review hearing.    Court makes stmt  -  addressed the DE.  DE does not have any objection to Judge Yackel doing this hearing.  Court questions DE.  DE addressed the Court.  
Court:  30 days good time is vacated and DE right to huber is re-instated for employment and counseling (needs to be approved by the jail as to counseling)

Defendant Brecca A. Benton in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State recites plead to both counts in amended complaint sentence to impose/stay consecutive if revoked probation 2 years - AODA - any counseling - $673.50 each count and 15 CF 138 to be dismissed.  Atty Hoffman agrees as does the defendant.  Defendant entered plea of nc as to amended charges.  Court finds defendant guilty count 1 and 2 in 15 CF 74 as amended.  15 CF 138 is dismissed.  State argues sentence.  Atty Hoffman makes arguement.  Defendant addressed the Court.

COURT:  COUNT 1: impose/stay 1 yr jail - 

COUNT 2:  30 days county jail consecutive to count 1 impose/stayed
